meanings.definition: Capable of being repaired or fixed.
meanings.sent1: The torn shirt was mendable with a simple stitch.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was easily mendable with some glue.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet was mendable with a quick twist of a wrench.
meanings.sent4: Her broken heart felt mendable after talking to her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The cracked vase was so mendable that it looked good as new after being glued back together.

meanings.definition: Able to be improved or corrected.
meanings.sent1: His grades were mendable with some extra study sessions.
meanings.sent2: The recipe was mendable by adding a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent3: The messy room was mendable with a little organization.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was mendable after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent5: The dull painting became mendable with a few vibrant brushstrokes.
